bibl.title: Dougherty v. Banta. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States Dist. Court of the 3d. Judl. Dist. of Washington Territory holding terms at Steilacoom- for Pierce County
To the Sheriff of Pierce County Greeting--

In the name of the United States you are hereby commanded, that ou have the body of John Dougherty, by you imprisoned and detained as it--is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said John Dougherty shall be called on charged, before Orange Jacobs, Chief Justice of Wash. Tery. Judge of the 3d. Judl. Dist., at the Courtroom of the District Court of said district in and for Pierce County, on the 10th day of March A.D. 1874. at the home of one O'Clock in the afternoon of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be coincidence concerning the said John Dougherty--
And have you then and there this and-- Witness the Hon. O.Jacobs
